message.content:
<<<api>>>: StringTokenizer.nextToken
<<<code>>>: 
```java
String str1 = "ashdef";
StringTokenizer tokenizer = new StringTokenizer(str1, "\n");
String desiredString = tokenizer.nextToken();
```
<<<explanation>>>: 
The `StringTokenizer.nextToken` method can be used to split a string into tokens based on a specified delimiter. In this case, we can use the newline character (`\n`) as the delimiter to split the string `str1`. By calling `tokenizer.nextToken()`, we can retrieve the first token before the newline character, which in this case is "ash". This will give us the desired string.
